location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.3160 of 1852 from Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay, to Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Covering letter with an enclosure: letter no.2968 of 1852 (f 128) from Malet to Major Atkins Hamerton, HM's Consul and HC's Agent in the Dominions of His Highness the Imam of Muscat, dated 3 July 1852. In the enclosure, Malet writes with reference to the recent grounding and plunder of the British ship Centauroff the Muscat coast. Malet requests from Major Hamerton any information he can procure on who carries responsibility for the incident, as well as details of relations between the Beni boo Ali tribe [Bani bu Ali, who carried out the plunder of the vessel] and the Imam of Muscat.
